title: Contract Testing Concepts Quiz
description: Test your understanding of API contract testing principles.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of contract testing?
options: To test individual functions in isolation
To verify API shape and types match expectations between systems
To test complete user workflows end-to-end
questions.explanation: Contract testing specifically verifies that the interface (contract) between systems matches expectations.

questions.text: Which is an example of a BREAKING change in an API?
options: Adding a new optional field to a response
Removing a field from a response
Adding a new optional query parameter
questions.explanation: Removing a field from a response is a breaking change because existing clients that expect that field will fail.

questions.text: What is the main advantage of Serverpod's approach to contracts?
options: It uses compile-time code generation for type-safe client/server communication
It runs faster than other frameworks
It requires no testing at all
questions.explanation: Serverpod generates Dart classes for both server and client from a single model definition, catching type mismatches at compile time.

questions.text: In consumer-driven contract testing, who defines the contract?
options: The consumer (frontend) specifies what it needs
The contracts are auto-generated from code
questions.explanation: In consumer-driven contracts, the consumer (frontend) defines what it needs from the API. The provider (backend) then verifies it can satisfy all consumer contracts.
